meanings.sent1: She is very extraverted and loves meeting new people.
meanings.sent2: He is known for his extraverted personality and always enjoys social gatherings.
meanings.sent3: The extraverted puppy eagerly greeted everyone at the park.
meanings.sent4: Her extraverted nature shines brightly in group settings.
meanings.sent5: The extraverted sunflower stood tall among the other flowers.

meanings.definition: Characterized by an interest in external objects or events.
meanings.sent1: His extraverted curiosity led him to explore new places.
meanings.sent2: The extraverted child was always eager to learn about the world around them.
meanings.sent3: The extraverted cat was fascinated by the birds outside the window.
meanings.sent4: The extraverted telescope revealed distant galaxies in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The extraverted compass always pointed towards adventure.

meanings.definition: To direct one's interest outward or to things outside oneself.
meanings.sent1: She extraverted her energy into volunteering for the community.
meanings.sent2: He often extraverts his thoughts by engaging in meaningful conversations.
meanings.sent3: The students were encouraged to extravert their creativity through art projects.
meanings.sent4: The company decided to extravert their focus on environmental sustainability.
meanings.sent5: The chef extraverted his passion for cooking through his delicious dishes.
